qas.question: On what date does the Catholic Church celebrate the Feast of the Assumption?
What do Eastern Catholics call the Feast of the Assumption?
On what date of the Julian calendar do Eastern Catholics celebrate the Domition of the Theotokos?
How many Great Feasts does the Eastern Orthodox Church celebrate?
Do Protestants celebrate Marian feasts or not?
What is the name of the first Feast attended by Mary?
When did Mary attend the Feast of Assumption?
When did Mary attend the Dormition of the Theotokos?
When Mary finished attending all of the Feasts, what were the Feasts referred to as?
Who did Mary not get to go to Feast with?

context: Differences in feasts may also originate from doctrinal issues—<b5_0>the Feast of the Assumption<b5_0/> is such an example. Given that there is no agreement among all Christians on the circumstances of the death, Dormition or Assumption of Mary, the feast of assumption is celebrated among some denominations and not others.  While the Catholic Church celebrates the Feast of the Assumption on <a0_0><b6_0>August 15<b6_0/><a0_0/>, some Eastern Catholics celebrate it as <a1_0>Dormition of the Theotokos<a1_0/>, and may do so on <a2_0><b7_0>August 28<b7_0/><a2_0/>, if they follow the Julian calendar. The Eastern Orthodox also celebrate it as the Dormition of the Theotokos, one of their <a3_0><b8_0>12<a3_0/> Great Feasts<b8_0/>. <b9_0>Protestants<b9_0/> <a4_0>do not<a4_0/> celebrate this, or any other Marian feasts.
